Civil defence: grants
	The following shall be substituted for section 3 of the Civil Defence Act[1948 (c. 5)](/id/ukpga/1948/5?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")(grants) in so far as it applies in relation to authorities in England orWales—
	“3Fixed grant
		For each financial year the designated Minister shall make grants toauthorities on whom functions are conferred under section 2.
		For each financial year the designated Minister shall—
			determine the aggregate amount of grants to be made under subsection (1),
			determine for each authority the amount of grant (if any) to be made undersubsection (1),
			publish each amount determined under paragraph (a) or (b),
			publish any formula or other criteria used to determine whether to make agrant to an authority, and
			publish any formula or other criteria used to determine the amount of agrant.
		The designated Minister—
			may use different formulae or other criteria in making determinations fordifferent authorities, and
			may vary a determination by a further determination.
	ADiscretionary grant
		The designated Minister may make a grant to an authority on whom a function isconferred under section 2 (whether or not in addition to any grant undersection 3).
	BPayment 
		Grant under section 3 or 3A shall be paid in such manner and at such timeas the designated Minister determines.
		In particular—
			a grant for a financial year need not be paid in that year, and
			a grant may be paid in instalments.
		A grant under section 3 or 3A may be conditional.
		An authority shall repay to the designated Minister any sum which—
			the authority receives by way of grant under section 3 for a financialyear, and
			exceeds the amount to which the authority is entitled under that sectionfor that year (whether or not by virtue of a varying determination undersection 3(3)(b)).”
		In section 2(3) of the Civil Protection in Peacetime Act [1986 (c.22)](/id/ukpga/1986/22?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (emergency) forthe words “regulations made under section 3 of that Act” there shall besubstituted the words “under section 3 or 3A of that Act”.
General 
	This Act may be cited as the Civil Defence (Grant) Act 2002.
	This Act shall have effect in relation to—
		the financial year ending with 31st March 2003, and
		later financial years.
	This Act does not extend to Northern Ireland.
